sn52.11:1.1: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn52.11:1.2: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha, exchanged greetings with him … and said:
sn52.11:2.1: “What things has Venerable Anuruddha developed and cultivated to attain great direct knowledge?”
sn52.11:2.2: “Reverends, I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.11:2.4: I meditate observing an aspect of the body …
sn52.11:2.7: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.11:2.8: I attained great direct knowledge by developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn52.11:2.9: And it’s because of developing and cultivating these four kinds of mindfulness meditation that I recollect a thousand eons.”
